intro: Leucotrichum, commonly known as the silver hair grass, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its fine, silvery hairs that cover the stems and leaves, giving it a distinctive appearance. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and thrive in moist, well-drained soils. Leucotrichum species are often used in ornamental landscaping due to their delicate and decorative foliage. They produce small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually wind-pollinated.
